body: Could you submit the issue in English or send a pull request to fix the issue?
Prefer to close it and reopen or open another PR if @seifehu is ready

@tuohai666 I hope you could refactor the existed codes of ShardingSphere plugins in this issue too, there're many duplicated codes, we could have much more clean codes :smile:

maybe a `shardingsphere-commons` module or whatever I don't know, maybe take the `Spring` plugins as an example
These two parameters are passed from the front end. The backend determines which indexes the query data is based on these two times
You have the time-related parameter already. You should not break all.
i have the same problem, but the document is not found ,how did you deal it ? very thanks
@Rainbowboys

- startSecondTB and endSecondTB are not real time. 
- If I calculate the real time through these two parameters, I must get the parameter Step according to org.apache.skywalking.oap.server.core.query.DurationUtils and I must put this conversion in ElasticSearchClient. This will form a circular dependency between the library-client module and server-core

> startSecondTB and endSecondTB are not real time.

What do you mean not real? It is the exact time the client side query. And `Downsampling` is there too. What do you need? That is all. This is just an optimization inside the ES implementation, breaking all is not a good idea.
@kezhenxu94 You are right. ShardingSphere changed api or package name in every release, more plugins will be provided subsequently. It's time to extract common codes.
It makes sense that I can convert to real time by downsampling and bucket.
This is just your ES server unreachable.
It will active at middle night.

no,my ES server is reachable.Skywalking UI  is normal，but The above error log will be printed at intervals。And I found in the trace dashboard there are only 10,000 traces, in fact more than it
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/37063302/72323385-909e7000-36e3-11ea-8239-7a0c52a4319f.png)
tks .got it !
My point is, that this is not in the SkyWalking control.  Maybe ES is not powerful enough, you need to scale out.

The meaning of 'cpm' and 'maxDouble' is STILL missing. And, what does the

> 120ms and 124 are considered same

mean? I DID NOT see '120ms' or '124' anywhere.

Can I think `from(All.latency).p99(120ms)` is the same as`from(All.latency).p99(124)` ?
The parameter is the precision. 120/10 == 124/10. So, in the stat level, they are the same response time.
Removed long time ago. Check the changelog.
thank you!~ 了解！~

upgraded to 6.6.0, all exit/local span are ignored and no longer need to register, but some endpoints i needed is also among it, eg. RabbitMQ/Topic/xxxQueue/xxx.xxx/Producer which relates to RabbitMQ/Topic/xxxQueue/xxx.xxx/Comsumer, i will traversing those endpoints to retrieve their endpoint topologies, to draw a map of relationship between endpoints.
how to solve this?

most of the exit span indeed waste too much resources, eg. Mysql/JDBI/Statement/executeQuery, but some endpoints which acts as BRIDGE between two or more services should be registed whether it is exit/local span or not.
what do you think?
We don't have any relationship analysis about the MQ producer/consumer ever.
yes, we have such demands, and i analysis endpoint topology to do that.
I think upstream wouldn't include that, as our endpoint topology is not the one you mentioned.
yes, i forget to mention the skywalking_endpoint_inventory, combines with endpoint topology, i can draw a map of endpoint relationship with their name.
i didn't make it clear, i mean i will retrieve endpoints of each service, then retrieve endpoint topology of each endpoint.
for this demand, i add a searchEndpointByTime() to search endpoints by time period and ignore DetectPoint condition.
i also have the problem
We have endpoint dependency map, also you could use that to draw topology. But not the one you mentioned. So, I am afraid your thing is a private version only.
Time conversion is placed in server-storage-plugin module
yes, our demands are quite special.
You are doing a lot convert but no clear meaning and assumpting traceId is meaningful, which isn't.
@ascrutae  Can you provide a new document address? thanks
Also, I noticed the e2e fails.

This pr has two important methods. The first is formatIndexNames. It determines the index list based on aliases and restrictions. The second method is convertBucketTotIimestamp. It converts bucket time to timestamp as a parameter of formatIndexNames

> This pr has two important methods. The first is formatIndexNames. It determines the index list based on aliases and restrictions. The second method is convertBucketTotIimestamp. It converts bucket time to timestamp as a parameter of formatIndexNames

First, why timestamp as a parameter of index name, rather than timeBucket? I remember timeBucket should be suffix of index name. What changed?

> First, why timestamp as a parameter of index name, rather than timeBucket? I remember timeBucket should be suffix of index name. What changed?

Buckets have different forms, but it is not a timestamp. The timestamp after this conversion is needed to determine the index list.
That is not I expected and should be unnecessary. The index list could be determined through time directly as TTL is a solid rule.

What I mean by determining the index list is to determine the position of the query data according to the time window, in order to reduce unnecessary index queries. 

Do you mean time by bucket?

Mainly because the MetadataQuery class uses the StartTimeToTimestamp and endTimeToTimestamp methods of DurationUtils to convert the time passed by the front end. 
So in order to maintain consistency, the new convertBucketTotIimestamp method in the DurationUtils class uses startTimeToTimestamp and endTimeToTimestamp to convert time.
You are talking about timestamp, But why we need that? All data and index names include the time bucket only.

> You are talking about timestamp, But why we need that? All data and index names include the time bucket only.

Essentially we want to take the intersection of the query time interval and the actual time interval. This calculation needs to be compared with the current time and incremental calculation of time, so the bucket needs to be converted to timestamp.
That is my point, we don't. The es ttl is based on day and month only. By considering downsampling, we have enough information already. Please rethink again, converting to timestamp is not helping.

Sorry, relevant docker images only run as the root user. If you want a
non-root user, PR is welcome.

yuquan-wang <notifications@github.com> 于2020年1月15日周三 下午1:33写道：

> Please answer these questions before submitting your issue.
>

>    - Question or discussion
>

> Question
>
>    - What do you want to know?
>    Is there a way to run skywalking-kubernetes project with non-root
>    permission. i set it up with default configuration, but got error like
>    "container has runAsNonRoot and image will run as root", my workaround is
>    editing chart file to run as root, which is not that easy since our k8s
>    doesn't allow root container(which means i need to specify psp).
>    so i wonder if there is an easy to to configure to run as non-root?

This type could be affected by many plugins, you need to debug or just simply ignore this. This is not important.
Thks.
I don't deal with TTL yet. That can be implemented by RetentationPolicy, a InfluxDB built-in feature.
You may have to Change JDK to `8 version` that mentioned [HERE](https://github.com/apache/skywalking/blob/master/docs/en/guides/How-to-build.md#build-from-github).
Powerful storage plugin～
Also, as we should market this feature, before 7.0.0 release, @dmsolr you should do some performance tests comparing this with ES storage in the same case. I am assuming this one has advantages :)

I don't use spring-devtools or any other classloader.
skywalking seems to have some other problem

MySQL case, https://github.com/apache/skywalking/tree/master/test/plugin/scenarios/mysql-scenario, run for every single commit of this repo with other 700+ plugin test cases. Don't have the issue you described. So, I still think this is related to your deployment or classloader issue.

maybe this is about mybatis?
I use mybatis to access mysql,I see your test case using jdbc
@wu-sheng
For javaagent, there is no difference between these. MyBatis is using JDBC driver too.
You don't need to close, the `compile` is really a typo. Just don't change this command.
I revert that part of the change for you. `compile` should be `compiling`.
Thank you for rectification.
199th contributor~
What do you mean you can't? Have you imported the project into your IDE?

> What do you mean you can't? Have you imported the project into your IDE?

I download the source code and remote debug the agent.
in pluginLoader which have 2 calsspath(apache-skywalking-apm-bin/agent/plugins and ../agent/activations) can not find that cls
@wu-sheng
It is there.

> It is there.

in which jar?

TTL and index positioning have these differences:
1.ttl is an internal timing task. It traverses all models, calculates s according to the predefined index retention time, then deletes the lower boundary of the index, and calculates the upper boundary according to the current time. Then delete the index outside this interval. Only the two parameters of downsampling (carried in the modle) and the defined data ttl time are needed here.
2. Index positioning needs to calculate the interval within a user-defined time. The user-defined time will be converted into other forms in the query-graphql-plugin. I must unify the time form in order to use it in index positioning.

I know the codes are different. My point is, logically, they are doing very similar things. Again, I am not saying your codes are wrong, I just hope you could keep the changes as less as possible, and as clear as possible. Now, your codes include a lot of changes, mixed with existing logic. Some of these changes are not necessary for the way today. 

Maybe this makes you feel frustrating, but I have to set these requirements, as I also set the same requirements at #4220 review. All codes we accepted are the legacy of all contributors and users. We must keep them friendly to ready. Think in this way, you could simply change codes to finish what you want because all former contributors accepted these requirements.
Your change should be clearly using time range and unit(downsampling) to calulate the indexes, right? But look at your codes, they are not clear.
That is not supported today. To support this, the alarm should support the metrics of relationship, then you could set alarm at the client-side relationship metrics.

> 199th contributor~

Yes, we are closing the 200th. Who will own the honor? :)
when this function can use?
English only.

now I find the issue is Caused by: java.lang.ClassNotFoundException: Can't find org.apache.skywalking.apm.agent.core.plugin.interceptor.enhance.InstanceMethodsAroundInterceptor

All errors are about no suitable driver of MySQL, but it should be downloaded in CI process.

> when this function can use?

It depends on who and when will contribute this feature. AFAIK, no committer is working on this.

Structurally, I certainly hope that the logic of time conversion is put into the ElasticSearchClient class, so that the change area is small. And I want to put the time conversion logic into DurationUtils in order to keep the same logic. 
In this case, the ElasticSearchClient class will depend on the DurationUtils class, causing a circular dependency. This caused each class in the server-storage-plugin to be added with the time conversion logic. 
But for the time being, I can put the time conversion logic into ElasticSearchClient without relying on DurationUtils. I will try
